001package imagingbook.lib.image.access;
002
003import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
004import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
005import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
006
007/**
008 * Image accessor for scalar images with 32-bit (float) values.
009 */
010public class FloatAccessor extends ScalarAccessor {
011        private final float[] pixels;
012
013        /**
014         * Constructor. Creates a new image accessor of type {@link FloatAccessor}. See also the
015         * generic factory method
016         * {@link ScalarAccessor#create(ImageProcessor, OutOfBoundsStrategy, InterpolationMethod)}.
017         * 
018         * @param ip  an instance of {@link FloatProcessor}
019         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy to be used (use {@code null} for
020         *            default settings)
021         * @param ipm the interpolation method to be used (use {@code null} for default
022         *            settings)
023         */
024        public FloatAccessor(FloatProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
025                super(ip, obs, ipm);
026                this.pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        public float getVal(int u, int v) {
031                int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
032                if (i < 0)
033                        return this.defaultValue;
034                else
035                        return pixels[i];
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
040                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height) {
041                        pixels[width * v + u] = val;
042                }
043        }
044}
